title: Gallery Talk: The Painters of Modern Life
hero_caption: Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Lunch at the Restaurant Fournaise, 1875. Potter Palmer Collection.
description:
Though Impressionist artists are perhaps most well known for their depictions of the natural environment, they also painted enduring portraits of people living in a rapidly modernizing world. In this tour, facilitated by educator Nancy Chen, we will examine and discuss portraits by Pierre-Auguste Renoir, Gustave Caillebotte, Edgar Degas and others that showcase Impressionism’s aesthetic range and provide a window into life in France at the end of the 19th century.

Please note: This tour accommodates up to 30 people on a first-come, first-served basis. If the tour reaches capacity, a second tour will be added at 12:45–1:30. Anyone not accommodated at the first tour will receive a sticker reserving their place at the later one.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program. 

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.
